title: A pleasant song made by a souldier whose bringing up had been dainty: and partly by those affections of his unbridled youth, is now beaten with his own rod; and therefore termeth this his Repentance, or, the fall of folly, to an excellent new tune, called Calino,
author: Hill, Thomas, fl. 1680. Doleful dance, and song of death. aut
publisher: Printed  for F. Coles, J. Wright, T. Vere, and W. Gilbertson,
